summary.p: The HTTP protocol recommends that clients should be "liberal in what they accept", and servers "strict with what they send". In some cases it can be difficult to detect when a server or an application has been misconfigured, is serving uncacheable content or is behaving suboptimally, as an HTTP client might be compensating for the server. These problems can potentially lead to excessive bandwidth consumption, or a server outage under load.

The mod_policy module consists of a set of filters that test servers for HTTP protocol compliance. These tests allow the server administrator to log violations of, or outright reject responses where certain defined conditions exist.

This could be used as a way to set minimum HTTP protocol compliance criteria for a restful application. Alternatively, a reverse proxy or cache could be configured to protect itself from misconfigured origin servers or unexpectedly uncacheable content, or as a mechanism to detect configuration mistakes within the server itself.

section.title: Actions
section.p: If a policy is violated, one of the following actions can be taken:

dl.dd: The policy check will be ignored for the given URL space, even if the filter is present.
The policy check will be executed, and if a violation is detected a warning will be logged to the server error_log, and a Warning header added to the response for the benefit of the client.

The policy check will be executed, and if a violation is detected an error will be logged to the server error_log, a Warning header added to the response, and a 502 Bad Gateway will be returned to the client. Optional links to explanatory documentation can be added to each error message, detailing the origin of each policy.

section.p: It is also possible to selectively disable all policies for a given URL space, should the need arise, using the PolicyFilter directive.
Alternatively, the PolicyEnvironment directive can be used to specify an environment variable, which if present, will cause the policies to be selectively downgraded or bypassed.

section.title: Policy Tests
section.p: The following policy filters are available:

dl.dd: Content types that are syntactically invalid or blank can be detected and the request rejected. Types can be restricted to a specific list containing optional wildcards ? and *.
dl.dt: POLICY_LENGTH : Enforce the presence of a Content-Length
dl.dd: The length of responses can be specified in one of three ways, by specifying an explicit length in advance, using chunked encoding to set the length, or by setting no length at all and terminating the request when complete. The absence of a specific content length can affect the cacheability of the response, and prevents the use of keepalive during HTTP/1.0 requests. This policy enforces the presence of an explicit content length on the response.
dl.dt: POLICY_KEEPALIVE : Enforce the option to keepalive
dl.dd: Less restrictive than the POLICY_LENGTH test, this policy enforces the possibility that the response can be kept alive. If the response doesn't have a protocol defined zero length, and the response isn't already an error, and the response has neither a Content-Length or is declared HTTP/1.1 and lacks Content-Encoding: chunked, then this response will be rejected.
dl.dt: POLICY_VARY : Enforce the absence of certain headers within Vary headers
dl.dd: If the Vary header contains any of the headers specified, this policy will reject the request. The typical case is the presence of the User-Agent within Vary, which is likely to cause a denial of service condition to a cache.
dl.dt: POLICY_VALIDATION: Enforce the presence of Etag and/or Last-Modified
dl.dd: The ability for a cache to determine whether a cached entity can be refreshed is dependent on whether a valid Etag and/or Last-Modified header is present to revalidate against. The absence of both headers, or the invalid syntax of a header will cause this policy to be rejected.
dl.dt: POLICY_CONDITIONAL: Enforce correct operation of conditional requests
dl.dd: When conditional headers are present in the request, a server should respond with a 304 Not Modified or 412 Precondition Failed response where appropriate. A server may ignore conditional headers, and this affects the efficiency of the HTTP caching mechanism. This policy rejects requests where a conditional header is present, and a 304 or 412 response code was expected, but a 2xx response was seen instead.

When a response is encountered that declares itself explicitly uncacheable, the request is rejected. A response is considered uncacheable if it specifies any of the following:
Cache-Control: no-cache
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-store
Cache-Control: private

When a response is encountered where the freshness lifetime is less than the given value, or the freshness lifetime is heuristic, the request is rejected. A response is checked in the following order:
If s-maxage is present but too small; or
If max-age is present but too small; or
If Expires is present and invalid; or
Date is present and invalid; or
Expires minus Date is too small; or
No s-maxage, maxage, or Expires/Date declared at all
dl.dt: POLICY_VERSION : Enforce a minimum HTTP version within a request
dl.dd:
When a request is encountered with an HTTP version number less than the required minimum version, the request is rejected. The following version numbers are recognised:
HTTP/1.1
HTTP/1.0
HTTP/0.9

section.title: Example Configuration
section.p: A typical configuration protecting a server serving static content might be as follows:
section.highlight:
<Location /> SetOutputFilter POLICY_TYPE;POLICY_LENGTH;POLICY_KEEPALIVE;POLICY_VARY;POLICY_VALIDATION; \ POLICY_CONDITIONAL;POLICY_NOCACHE;POLICY_MAXAGE;POLICY_VERSION
# content type must be present and valid, but can be anything PolicyType enforce */*
# reject if no explicitly declared content length PolicyLength enforce
# covered by the policy length filter PolicyKeepalive ignore
# reject if User-Agent appears within Vary headers PolicyVary enforce User-Agent
# we want to enforce validation PolicyValidation enforce
# non-functional conditional responses should be rejected PolicyConditional enforce
# no-cache responses should be rejected PolicyNocache enforce
# maxage must be at least a day PolicyMaxage enforce 86400
# request version can be anything PolicyVersion ignore HTTP/1.1 </Location>
# suppress policy protection for server-status <Location /server-status> PolicyFilter off </Location>

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyFilter
directivesynopsis.description: Enable or disable policies for the given URL space.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyFilter is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: Master switch to enable or disable policies for a given URL space.

example.title: Example
example.highlight:
# enabled by default <Location /> PolicyFilter on </Location>
# suppress policy protection for server-status <Location /server-status> PolicyFilter off </Location>

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyEnvironment
directivesynopsis.description: Override policies based on an environment variable.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyEnvironment is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: Downgrade policies to logging only or ignored based on the presence of an environment variable. If the given variable is present and equal to the log-value, enforced policies will be logged instead. If the given variable is present and equal to the ignore-value, all policies will be ignored.

example.title: Example
example.highlight: # downgrade if POLICY_CONTROL was present PolicyEnvironment POLICY_CONTROL log ignore

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyConditional
directivesynopsis.description: Enable the conditional request policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyConditional is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: When logged or enforced, a response that should have been conditional but wasn't will be rejected.

example.title: Example
example.highlight: # non-functional conditional responses should be rejected PolicyConditional enforce

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyConditionalURL
directivesynopsis.description: URL describing the conditional request policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyConditionalURL is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: Specify the URL of the documentation describing the conditional request policy, to appear within error messages.

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyLength
directivesynopsis.description: Enable the content length policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyLength is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: When logged or enforced, a response that lacks an explicit Content-Length header will be rejected.

example.title: Example
example.highlight: # missing Content-Length header should be rejected PolicyLength enforce

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyLengthURL
directivesynopsis.description: URL describing the content length policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyLengthURL is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: Specify the URL of the documentation describing the content length policy, to appear within error messages.

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyKeepalive
directivesynopsis.description: Enable the keepalive policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyKeepalive is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: When logged or enforced, a response that lacks both an explicit Content-Length header and a Transfer-Encoding of chunked will be rejected.

example.title: Example
example.highlight: # missing Content-Length or Transfer-Encoding should be rejected PolicyKeepalive enforce

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyKeepaliveURL
directivesynopsis.description: URL describing the keepalive policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyKeepaliveURL is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: Specify the URL of the documentation describing the keepalive policy, to appear within error messages.

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyType
directivesynopsis.description: Enable the content type policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyType is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: When logged or enforced, a response that lacks a Content-Type header, where the Content-Type header is malformed, or where the header does not match the given pattern or patterns will be rejected.

example.title: Example
example.highlight: # enforce json or XML PolicyType enforce application/json text/xml

example.title: Example
example.highlight: # malformed content type should be rejected PolicyType enforce */*

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyTypeURL
directivesynopsis.description: URL describing the content type policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyTypeURL is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: Specify the URL of the documentation describing the content type policy, to appear within error messages.

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyVary
directivesynopsis.description: Enable the Vary policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyVary is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: When logged or enforced, a response that contains a Vary header which in turn contains one of the headers listed, will be rejected.

example.title: Example
example.highlight: # reject reponses with "User-Agent" listed in the Vary header PolicyVary enforce User-Agent

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyVaryURL
directivesynopsis.description: URL describing the content type policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyVaryURL is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: Specify the URL of the documentation describing the vary policy, to appear within error messages.

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyValidation
directivesynopsis.description: Enable the validation policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyValidation is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: When logged or enforced, a response that lacks either a valid ETag header or a Last-Modified header, or where either header is syntactically incorrect, will be rejected.

example.title: Example
example.highlight: # no ETag or Last-Modified will be rejected PolicyValidation enforce

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyValidationURL
directivesynopsis.description: URL describing the content type policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyValidationURL is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: Specify the URL of the documentation describing the validation policy, to appear within error messages.

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyNocache
directivesynopsis.description: Enable the caching no-cache policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyNocache is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: When logged or enforced, a response that defines itself uncacheable using the Cache-Control or Pragma headers will be rejected.

example.title: Example
example.highlight: # Cache-Control: no-cache will be rejected PolicyNocache enforce

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyNocacheURL
directivesynopsis.description: URL describing the caching no-cache policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyNocacheURL is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: Specify the URL of the documentation describing the caching no-cache policy, to appear within error messages.

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyMaxage
directivesynopsis.description: Enable the caching minimum max-age policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyMaxage is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: When logged or enforced, a response that lacks an explicit freshness lifetime defined with max-age, s-maxage or an Expires header, or where the explicit freshness lifetime is smaller than the given value, will be rejected.

example.title: Example
example.highlight: # reject responses with a freshness lifetime shorter than a day PolicyMaxage enforce 86400

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyMaxageURL
directivesynopsis.description: URL describing the caching minimum freshness lifetime policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyMaxageURL is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: Specify the URL of the documentation describing the caching minimum freshness lifetime policy, to appear within error messages.

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyVersion
directivesynopsis.description: Enable the version policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyVersion is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: When logged or enforced, a request with a version lower than specified will be rejected.

example.title: Example
example.highlight: # reject requests with an HTTP version older than HTTP/1.1 PolicyVersion enforce HTTP/1.1

directivesynopsis.name: PolicyVersionURL
directivesynopsis.description: URL describing the minimum request HTTP version policy.
directivesynopsis.compatibility: PolicyVersionURL is only available in Apache 2.5.0 and later.

usage.p: Specify the URL of the documentation describing the minimum request HTTP version policy, to appear within error messages.
